Cheng Wang

About · Projects

About Me

Hey! I am currently a postdoc research scientist in Prof. Yingkai Zhang's lab at New York Univeristy. I work on the development of deep learning models to aid drug design.

Previously, I have developed new computational tools to understand protein-protein interactions using machine learning and molecular modeling during my Ph.D. study. I am interested in using data mining, data visualization, and machine learning to understand and to solve problems.

Publications

Improving Scoring-Docking-Screening Powers of Protein–Ligand Scoring Functions using Random Forest
C. Wang, and Y. Zhang, J. Comput. Chem., 38, 169-177 (2017).
AlphaSpace: Fragment-Centric Topographical Mapping to Target Protein-Protein Interaction Interfaces
D. W. Rooklin, C. Wang, J. Katigbak, P. S. Arora, and Y. Zhang, J. Chem. Inf. Model., 55, 1585-1599 (2015).
